byline.original: By BILL VLASIC and MARY M. CHAPMAN

abstract: Unofficial voting tallies show hourly workers at Fiat Chrysler Automobiles have rejected proposed new United Automobile Workers union contract; four-year deal proposed no set limit on amount of lower-paid workers and no method to move them up to top wage levels.
lead_paragraph: The outcome, if confirmed, would be the first time in more than 20 years Chrysler workers have turned down a contract negotiated by their union.

headline.main: Fiat Chrysler Workers Appear to Reject Contract Proposal
headline.print_headline: U.A.W. Is Said to Flatly Reject Fiat Chrysler Contract Offer

snippet: The outcome, if confirmed, would be the first time in more than 20 years Chrysler workers have turned down a contract negotiated by their union.
